caption:
This photograph features an elderly couple posing for the camera outdoors during what appears to be a sunny day. The man, positioned on the left, is dressed in a light-colored overcoat over a similarly light-hued suit and a patterned tie. He also wears rectangular glasses and has receding gray hair. The woman, on the right, is slightly smiling, wearing large round glasses and a dark quilted jacket over a lighter sweater. Her hair is styled in a curly, voluminous manner and has a reddish-brown color.

The background of the photograph shows a serene outdoor setting, likely in a park or a large backyard with expanses of grass. There are tree branches overhead, and another mature, leafy tree is visible in the bright daylight slightly behind them. The clear blue sky suggests a fair weather day. The overall ambiance is pleasant and calm, indicating a peaceful moment spent together by the couple.
title: Dr. and Mrs. Karl Menninger attending the second annual Tallgrass Prairie National Park conference held at Elmdale Kansas, near Emporia. The founder of the famed Menninger Clinic in Topeka was honorary chairman of the conference and gave an inspirational talk, "You are gathered here out of love for one another". The conference was attended by members of Save the Tallgrass Prairie, Inc., Kansas chapter of the Sierra Club and National Audubon Society.
